id: 704.0081	Valeriy Tolstoy	V.N. Tolstoy (INP
submitter: Moscow State University)	Quantum Deformations of Relativistic Symmetries	"10 pages. Invited talk at the XXII Max Born Symposium ""Quantum

id: and Twistors""
title: Wroclaw (Poland)

id: Lukierski."				math.QA hep-th math-ph math.MP math.RT		"  We discussed quantum deformations of D=4 Lorentz and Poincare algebras. In
the case of Poincare algebra it is shown that almost all classical r-matrices
of S. Zakrzewski classification correspond to twisted deformations of Abelian
and Jordanian types. A part of twists corresponding to the r-matrices of
Zakrzewski classification are given in explicit form.

704.0082	Tetsuo Kurosaki	Tetsuo Kurosaki, Miki Wadati	Matter-Wave Bright Solitons with a Finite Background in Spinor
Bose-Einstein Condensates"	18 pages
authors: LaTeX		10.1143/JPSJ.76.084002		cond-mat.other cond-mat.stat-mech		"  We investigate dynamical properties of bright solitons with a finite

id: background in the F=1 spinor Bose-Einstein condensate (BEC)
integrable spinor model which is equivalent to the matrix nonlinear
Schr\""{o}dinger equation with a self-focusing nonlineality. We apply the
inverse scattering method formulated for nonvanishing boundary conditions. The
resulting soliton solutions can be regarded as a generalization of those under
vanishing boundary conditions. One-soliton solutions are derived in an explicit
manner. According to the behaviors at the infinity
two kinds
submitter: domain-wall (DW) type and phase-shift (PS) type. The DW-type implies

id: the ferromagnetic state with nonzero total spin and the PS-type implies the
polar state
submitter: where the total spin amounts to zero. We also discuss two-soliton

id: collisions. In particular
submitter: the spin-mixing phenomenon is confirmed in a

id: collision involving the DW-type. The results are consistent with those of the
previous studies for bright solitons under vanishing boundary conditions and
dark solitons. As a result
submitter: we establish the robustness and the usefulness of

id: the multiple matter-wave solitons in the spinor BECs.

704.0083	Andrei Barvinsky	A.O.Barvinsky	Why there is something rather than nothing (out of everything)?	4 pages, RevTex, several references added and minor changes done	Phys.Rev.Lett.99:071301,2007	10.1103/PhysRevLett.99.071301		hep-th		  The path integral over Euclidean geometries for the recently suggested
density matrix of the Universe is shown to describe a microcanonical ensemble
in quantum cosmology. This ensemble corresponds to a uniform (weight one)
distribution in phase space of true physical variables
observable spacetime geometry it is peaked about complex saddle-points of the
{\em Lorentzian} path integral. They are represented by the recently obtained
cosmological instantons limited to a bounded range of the cosmological
constant. Inflationary cosmologies generated by these instantons at late stages
of expansion undergo acceleration whose low-energy scale can be attained within
the concept of dynamically evolving extra dimensions. Thus
bounded range of the early cosmological constant
suggests the mechanism of constraining the landscape of string vacua and
simultaneously
submitter: a possible solution to the dark energy problem in the form of

id: the quasi-equilibrium decay of the microcanonical state of the Universe.

v1	Sun, 1 Apr 2007 12:38:03 GMT	v2	Mon, 9 Apr 2007 19:39:24 GMT	26-11-2008	Barvinsky	A. O.																																																																																																																																																																									
704.0084	Baruch Meerson	Itzhak Fouxon, Baruch Meerson, Michael Assaf, Eli Livne	Formation of density singularities in ideal hydrodynamics of freely
cooling inelastic gases: a family of exact solutions"	19 pages
submitter: 7 figures		10.1063/1.2767361		cond-mat.soft nlin.PS physics.flu-dyn		"  We employ granular hydrodynamics to investigate a paradigmatic problem of

id: clustering of particles in a freely cooling dilute granular gas. We consider
large-scale hydrodynamic motions where the viscosity and heat conduction can be
neglected
submitter: and one arrives at the equations of ideal gas dynamics with an

id: additional term describing bulk energy losses due to inelastic collisions. We
employ Lagrangian coordinates and derive a broad family of exact non-stationary
analytical solutions that depend only on one spatial coordinate. These
solutions exhibit a new type of singularity
submitter: where the gas density blows up in

id: a finite time when starting from smooth initial conditions. The density blowups
signal formation of close-packed clusters of particles. As the density blow-up
time $t_c$ is approached
submitter: the maximum density exhibits a power law $\sim

id: (t_c-t)^{-2}$. The velocity gradient blows up as $\sim - (t_c-t)^{-1}$ while
the velocity itself remains continuous and develops a cusp (rather than a shock
discontinuity) at the singularity. The gas temperature vanishes at the
singularity
submitter: and the singularity follows the isobaric scenario: the gas

id: pressure remains finite and approximately uniform in space and constant in time
close to the singularity. An additional exact solution shows that the density
blowup
title: at which the

id: hydrodynamic fields are discontinuous but finite. We confirm stability of the
exact solutions with respect to small one-dimensional perturbations by solving
the ideal hydrodynamic equations numerically. Furthermore
show that the local features of the density blowup hold universally
independently of details of the initial and boundary conditions.

v1	Sun, 1 Apr 2007 12:54:14 GMT	v2	Wed, 9 May 2007 07:00:42 GMT	13-11-2009	Fouxon	Itzhak		Meerson	Baruch		Assaf	Michael		Livne	Eli																																																																																																																																																																
704.0085	Partha Mukhopadhyay	Partha Mukhopadhyay	A Universality in PP-Waves	LaTeX file, 43 pages, one reference added, minor changes made	JHEP 0706:061,2007	10.1088/1126-6708/2007/06/061	DAMTP-2007-30	hep-th		  We discuss a universality property of any covariant field theory in
space-time expanded around pp-wave backgrounds. According to this property the
space-time lagrangian density evaluated on a restricted set of field
configurations
authors: turns out to be same around all the

id: pp-waves
authors: with same transverse space and same profiles for the

id: background scalars. In this paper we restrict our discussion to tensorial
fields only. In the context of bosonic string theory we consider on-shell
pp-waves and argue that universality requires the existence of a universal
sector of world-sheet operators whose correlation functions are insensitive to
the pp-wave nature of the metric and the background gauge flux. Such results
can also be reproduced using the world-sheet conformal field theory. We also
study such pp-waves in non-polynomial closed string field theory (CSFT). In
particular
submitter: we argue that for an off-shell pp-wave ansatz with flat transverse

id: space and dilaton independent of transverse coordinates the field redefinition
relating the low energy effective field theory and CSFT with all the massive
modes integrated out is at most quadratic in fields. Because of this
simplification it is expected that the off-shell pp-waves can be identified on
the two sides. Furthermore
submitter: given the massless pp-wave field configurations

id: iterative method for computing the higher massive modes using the CSFT
equations of motion has been discussed. All our bosonic string theory analyses
can be generalised to the common Neveu-Schwarz sector of superstrings.

704.0086	Vladislav Vysotsky	Vladislav V. Vysotsky	Clustering in a stochastic model of one-dimensional gas	Published in at http://dx.doi.org/10.1214/07-AAP481 the Annals of
Applied Probability (http://www.imstat.org/aap/) by the Institute of
Mathematical Statistics (http://www.imstat.org)"	Annals of Applied Probability 2008
title: 1026-1058	10.1214/07-AAP481	IMS-AAP-AAP481	math.PR		"  We give a quantitative analysis of clustering in a stochastic model of

id: one-dimensional gas. At time zero
submitter: the gas consists of $n$ identical particles

id: that are randomly distributed on the real line and have zero initial speeds.
Particles begin to move under the forces of mutual attraction. When particles
collide
submitter: they stick together forming a new particle
title: whose mass

id: and speed are defined by the laws of conservation. We are interested in the
asymptotic behavior of $K_n(t)$ as $n\to \infty$
number of clusters at time $t$ in the system with $n$ initial particles. Our
main result is a functional limit theorem for $K_n(t)$. Its proof is based on
the discovered localization property of the aggregation process
that the behavior of each particle is essentially defined by the motion of
neighbor particles.

spaces of dimensional $m$ and $n$ corresponding

authors: f^{n-1}):\partial H^m\to \partial H^n$ between geometric boundaries

id: of $H^m$ and $H^n$. Then for each $\epsilon >0$ there exists a harmonic map
$u:H^m\to H^n$ which is continuous up to the boundary (in the sense of
Euclidean) and $u|_{\partial H^m}=(f^1

v1	Sun, 1 Apr 2007 13:44:50 GMT	v2	Wed, 23 May 2007 12:49:52 GMT	13-06-2007	Duc	Duong Minh		Tuyen	Truong Trung																																																																																																																																																																						
704.0088	Nikolay Tcherniega V.	N.V.Tcherniega	Some new experimental photonic flame effect features	9 pages, 10 figures, accepted for publication in JRLR				physics.optics		  The results of the spectral
radiation in the presence of the photonic flame effect are presented.
Artificial opal posed on Cu plate at the temperature of liquid nitrogen boiling
point (77 K) being irradiated by nanosecond ruby laser pulse produces long-
term luminiscence with a duration till ten seconds with a finely structured
spectrum in the the antistocks part of the spectrum. Analogous visible
luminescence manifesting time delay appeared in other samples of the artificial
opals posed on the same plate. In the case of the opal infiltrated with
different nonlinear liquids the threshold of the luminiscence is reduced and
the spatial disribution of the bright emmiting area on the opal surface is
being changed. In the case of the putting the frozen nonlinear liquids on the
Cu plate long-term blue bright luminiscence took place in the frozen species of
the liquids. Temporal characteristics of this luminiscence are nearly the same
as in opal matrixes.

v1	Sun, 1 Apr 2007 14:10:51 GMT			23-05-2007	Tcherniega	N. V.																																																																																																																																																																									
704.0089	Igor Grabec	I. Grabec	A general approach to statistical modeling of physical laws:
nonparametric regression"	17 pages
authors: uses revtex4.cls				physics.data-an physics.gen-ph		"  Statistical modeling of experimental physical laws is based on the

id: probability density function of measured variables. It is expressed by
experimental data via a kernel estimator. The kernel is determined objectively
by the scattering of data during calibration of experimental setup. A physical
law
data by the conditional average estimator. It is derived directly from the
kernel estimator and corresponds to a general nonparametric regression. The
proposed method is demonstrated by the modeling of a return map of noisy
chaotic data. In this example
submitter: the nonparametric regression is used to predict

id: a future value of chaotic time series from the present one. The mean predictor
error is used in the definition of predictor quality
expressed by the mean square distance between data points. Both statistics are
used in a new definition of predictor cost function. From the minimum of the
predictor cost function
submitter: a proper number of data in the model is estimated.
